describe: Malawi, known as the 'Warm Heart of Africa', is a landlocked country in southeastern Africa. It is renowned for its stunning landscapes, including the vast and beautiful Lake Malawi, diverse wildlife, and rich cultural heritage.

cities.name: üèô Lilongwe
cities.geographical_location: Located in the central region of Malawi, Lilongwe is the capital city.
cities.climate: Lilongwe has a subtropical climate with distinct wet and dry seasons.
cities.famous_cuisine: Nsima (a type of cornmeal porridge), Chambo (a local fish from Lake Malawi), and Kachumbari (a fresh tomato and onion salad).

cities.name: üèô Blantyre
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the southern region of Malawi, Blantyre is the second-largest city.
cities.climate: Blantyre experiences a tropical savanna climate with a warm, wet season and a cooler, dry season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Mandasi (fried dough balls), Nkhwani (pumpkin leaves), and Chambo with rice.
popular_attractions: St. Michael and All Angels Church

cities.name: üèô Mzuzu
cities.geographical_location: Located in the northern region of Malawi, Mzuzu is the third-largest city.
cities.climate: Mzuzu has a temperate climate with a cooler, wet season and a dry season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Mbatata (sweet potato cookies), Chambo, and local teas.
